description: Maximal size of the commutator subgroup of G where G is a finite group of order n.
comments: a(n) = 1 iff n belongs to sequence A051532. - Avi Peretz (njk(AT)netvision.net.il), Feb 27 2001
links: Eric M. Schmidt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
formula: For prime p and m >= 2, a(p^m) = p^(m - 2). - _Eric M. Schmidt_, Sep 20 2012
example: a(6) = 3 because the commutator subgroup of the symmetric group S_3 is the group Z_3.
prog: (GAP) A059807 := function(n) local max, fact, i; if (IsPrimePowerInt(n)) then fact := Factors(n); if (Length(fact) >= 2) then return n/fact[1]^2; fi; fi; max := 1; for i in [1..NumberSmallGroups(n)] do max := Maximum(max, Size(DerivedSubgroup(SmallGroup(n, i)))); od; return max; end; # _Eric M. Schmidt_, Sep 20 2012
author: Noam Katz (noamkj(AT)hotmail.com), Feb 24 2001
extensions: More terms from _Eric M. Schmidt_, Sep 20 2012
